Rouquier blocks of the cyclotomic Hecke algebras of G(de, e, r)
Maria Chlouveraki
Ecole Polytechnique Federale de Lausanne
e-mail : maria.chlouveraki@ep.ch
ABSTRACT. The Rouquier blocks of the cyclotomic Hecke algebras, intro-
duced by Rouquier, are a substitute for the families of characters, dened by
Lusztig for Weyl groups, which can be applied to all complex reection groups.
In this article, we determine them for the cyclotomic Hecke algebras of the
groups of the innite series, G(de, e, r), thus completing their calculation for all
complex reection groups.
Introduction
Until recently, the lack of Kazhdan-Lusztig bases for the non-Coxeter complex
reection groups did not allow the generalization of the notion of families of
characters from Weyl groups to all complex reection groups. However, thanks
to the results of Gyoja [12] and Rouquier [21], we have obtained a substitute for
the families of characters which can be applied to all complex reection groups.
In particular, Rouquier has proved that the families of characters of a Weyl
group W coincide with the Rouquier blocks of the Iwahori-Hecke algebra of
W , i.e., its blocks over a suitable coecient ring. This denition generalizes
to all complex reection groups and we are grateful for this for the following
reasons:
On one hand, since the families of characters of a Weyl group play an es-
sential role in the denition of the families of unipotent characters of the cor-
responding nite reductive group (cf. [14]), the families of characters of the
cyclotomic Hecke algebras could play a key role in the organization of families
of unipotent characters in general. On the other hand, for some (non-Coxeter)
complex reection groups W , we have data which seem to indicate that behind
the group W , there exists another mysterious object - the Spets (cf. [3], [18]) -
that could play the role of the series of nite reductive groups of Weyl group
W .
In [2], Broue and Kim presented an algorithm for the determination of the
Rouquier blocks of the cyclotomic Hecke algebras of the groups G(d, 1, r). Using
the generalization of some classic results, known as Cliord theory, they were
able to obtain the Rouquier blocks for G(d, d, r) from those of G(d, 1, r). Later,
Kim [13] generalized the methods used in [2] in order to obtain the Rouquier
blocks of the cyclotomic Hecke algebras of G(de, e, r) from those of G(de, 1, r).
As far as the exceptional complex reection groups are concerned, some
special cases were treated by Malle and Rouquier in [19]. Finally, in [5], we
gave the complete classication of the Rouquier blocks of the cyclotomic Hecke
algebras for all exceptional complex reection groups.
However, recently it was realized that the algorithm of [2] for G(d, 1, r) does
not work, unless d is a power of a prime number. In [7], we give the correct
algorithm, which is more complicated than the one of [2]. Now, it remains to
recalculate the Rouquier blocks of the cyclotomic Hecke algebras of G(de, e, r),

Using the same idea as in [13], we apply Cliord theory in order to obtain
the Rouquier blocks for G(de, e, r) from those of G(de, 1, r). However, we point

Cliord theory in order to obtain the Rouquier blocks for G(de, e, 2).
Finally, to every irreducible character of a cyclotomic Hecke algebra of a
complex reection group we can attach integers a and A, like Lusztig has done
for Weyl groups.
In [15], Lusztig shows that these integers are constant on
families. Here, we complete the proof that a and A are constant on the Rouquier
blocks of the cyclotomic Hecke algebras of all irreducible complex reection
groups, having already shown it for the exceptional ones (cf. [6]) and G(d, 1, r)
